text: Canadian Airlines used to be the second largest airline of Canada. It flew to all five continents. Calgary, Alberta used to be their headquarters and hub. Canadian was also a founding member of Oneworld alongside American Airlines, British Airways, Cathay Pacific and Qantas, but left the alliance in 2000. Air Canada bought the airline in 2000. ==References== Category:1987 establishments in Canada Category:2001 disestablishments in Canada Category:Airlines of Canada Category:Companies based in Alberta
title: Canadian Airlines
